alert.note: Alert for Livingston (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued August 24 at 1:21AM EDT until August 24 at 3:00AM EDT by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 AM EDT EARLY THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Urban and small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Michigan, including the following counties, Genesee, Livingston and Shiawassee. * WHEN...Until 500 AM EDT. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 118 AM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. This will cause urban and small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen since midnight. - Additional rainfall of 1 to 2 inches per hour is possible through 3 AM resulting in minor to moderate flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Flint, Owosso, Hartland, Fenton, Howell, Flushing, Grand Blanc, Brighton, Davison, Durand, Fowlerville, Clio, Pinckney, Perry, Laingsburg, New Lothrop, Burton, Hamburg, South Lyon and Swartz Creek. - http://www.floodsafety.noaa.gov
info.instruction: Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
